business.headline: Is buying a home in major Indian cities a mistake? Financial advisor explainsFinancial advisor Lovish Anand questions the wisdom of homeownership in high-cost Indian metros, highlighting the economic realities of renting versus buying.

Explained: Why IndusInd Bank shares rose 6% todayOver the last year, IndusInd Bank's stock had fallen by 43.51%. However, it has shown signs of recovery in recent weeks, rising around 8.63% in the past month.

Middle class has eroded: Startup founder flags growing financial stress in IndiaOnce a marker of steady growth, India's middle class now faces rising costs, slower salary gains, and shifting financial priorities in an economy where old assumptions no longer hold true.
Sensex, Nifty rise as markets stay calm despite Iran-Israel flare-upThe S&P BSE Sensex was up by 70.97 points to 81,654.27, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 44.50 points to 24,897.90 as of 9:28 am.

Oswal Pumps IPO allotment: Step-by-step guide to check statusOswal Pumps IPO allotment is set to be finalised on June 18, 2025, after a robust subscription. Investors can check their allotment status through BSE and Link Intime.

Indian stock market to open flat as Middle East tensions raise oil pricesAs of 8:23 am, Gift Nifty futures were trading at 24,852. This suggests that Nifty50 is likely to begin the day close to Tuesday's closing level of 24,853.4.

Stocks to watch on June 18: BSE, Delhivery, Bharat Forge, Vedanta, Ola ElectricAs investors wait to see how global events unfold, several stocks such as BSE, Delhivery, Bharat Forge, Vedanta, Ola Electric, are expected to remain in focus on Wednesday, June 18.
Sensex ends 213 points lower, Nifty below 24,900; Tata Motors down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 212.85 points to close at 81,583.30, while the NSE Nifty50 declined by 93.10 points to end at 24,853.40.

Savings account interest rates see sharp drop. Do you really need one?A look into the declining utility of savings accounts as interest rates fall, questioning their role in financial growth and suggesting alternative investment options.

Mule accounts, url masking: How forex trading platform OctaFX scammed investorsThe Enforcement Directorate on June 13 conducted raids at seven locations across four cities, and various incriminating documents and digital devices seized during the operation showed how forex trading platform - OctaFX - cheated investors and generated more than Rs 800 crore in less than a year.

Over 80% jump: The city that outpaced Delhi, Mumbai in property price growthOver the past four years, one city has quietly clocked an 80% surge in home prices, outshining Delhi, Mumbai, and Bengaluru.

Why the Strait of Hormuz matters to India amid Israel-Iran tensionsThe Strait of Hormuz is located between Iran to the north and Oman and the United Arab Emirates (UAE) to the south. It connects the Persian Gulf to the Gulf of Oman, and then to the Arabian Sea.

entertainment.headline: Liam Payne's girlfriend posts emotional note, says in constant state of missing youLiam Payne's girlfriend, Kate Cassidy, has opened up about her grief and memories of her late boyfriend in an emotional note. The 'One Direction' singer died after falling from a hotel balcony last year.

Scarlett Johansson, Jonathan Bailey's kiss lights up Jurassic World premiereActors Scarlett Johansson and Jonathan Bailey sparked online buzz after they were seen kissing at the 'Jurassic World Rebirth' premiere in London. The clip quickly went viral, prompting a wave of fan reactions across social media.

Alfred Brendel, Austrian pianist famous for his playing of Beethoven, dies at 94Alfred Brendel, one of the greatest pianists of the 20th century, died peacefully at his London home at the age of 94. Known for his profound interpretations of Beethoven, his career spanned over sixty years.
Marjorie Grande, singer Ariana Grande's grandmother, dies at 99Singer Ariana Grande's beloved "Nonna", Marjorie Grande, has died. She was 99 years old.

Vijay Deverakonda, Rashmika Mandanna make rare public appearance at Mumbai airportVijay Deverakonda and Rashmika Mandanna were seen leaving the Mumbai airport in the same car. Their appearance came amid their dating rumours.

Tom Cruise to finally get an Oscar, 35 years after his first nominationTom Cruise, Debbie Allen, Wynn Thomas, and Dolly Parton will receive honorary Oscars at the 2025 Governors Awards for their lasting impact on film and humanitarian work.

I am not scared: Veteran actor Aruna Irani on beating cancer twiceIn a recent interview, actor Aruna Irani opened up about beating cancer twice and how she chose surgery over chemotherapy during her first cancer diagnosis.

The Naked Gun trailer: Liam Neeson, Pamela Anderson lead action-comedy rebootThe official trailer for 'The Naked Gun', featuring Liam Neeson and Pamela Anderson was released by Paramount Pictures. The film is a reboot of the American action-comedy featuring Leslie Nielson in the lead role.

Ed Sheeran shares BTS of Sapphire shoot, says I love you IndiaEd Sheeran gave fans a glimpse of what went on behind the scenes of his new music video Sapphire, calling it the longest shoot of his career. In a recent Instagram post, he shared that the three-week shoot was tough but totally worth it, and also expressed his love for India.

Akshay Kumar draws stunt ideas from Tom & Jerry, calls it the most violent showAkshay Kumar revealed that many of his action stunts were inspired by the cartoon 'Tom & Jerry', which he considers full of creative and intense action. The actor shared how scenes from the show shaped iconic moments in his films like 'Sabse Bada Khiladi' and 'Khiladi 420'.
Akshay Kumar gives Hera Pheri fans hope after Paresh Rawal's exitBollywood star Akshay Kumar has addressed Paresh Rawal's sudden exit from Hera Pheri 3, expressing hope that everything will go well.

Actor Eric Dane fights back tears in 1st interview on ALS diagnosis, fans reactActor Eric Dane, who was recently diagnosed with ALS, opened up about his condition in a deeply emotional interview. Devastated fans around the world have expressed their heartbreak in response to the video.

Vivek Agnihotri says Deepika Padukone was unaware of JNU politics during 2020 visitDirector Vivek Agnihotri recently shared his views on actor Deepika Padukone's 2020 visit to the JNU campus during a protest. He also highlighted the risks associated with celebrities getting involved in politics.

Modern Family's Lily comes out as bisexual, quotes iconic 'I am gay' line from the showModern Family's child star Aubrey Anderson-Emmons comes out as bisexual. She shared a video of her lip-syncing to her iconic line, 'I am gay' from the show.

Dipika Kakar shares toughest moment after stage 2 cancer diagnosis in new vlogAfter undergoing surgery for stage 2 liver cancer, Dipika Kakar shared that the hardest part was having to abruptly wean her son, Ruhaan, off breastfeeding in a single night. She also expressed gratitude for the overwhelming love and support from her fans during this difficult time.

Dhanush calls Kuberaa a special film, thanks co-stars Nagarjuna and RashmikaAt the pre-release event of 'Kuberaa' in Hyderabad, actor Dhanush described his upcoming Telugu film as "special." Also starring Nagarjuna and Rashmika Mandanna, the film is set to release on June 20.

Nagarjuna says playing Rajinikanth's villain in Coolie is liberating. Here's whyTelugu actor Nagarjuna will play Rajinikanth's villain in director Lokesh Kanagaraj's 'Coolie'. In a recent interview, he called it a liberating experience.

Samyuktha joins Vijay Sethupathi in Puri Jagannadh's upcoming pan-India filmActor Samyuktha has been confirmed to play the lead role opposite Vijay Sethupathi in Puri Jagannadh's untitled pan-India project. The film will be released in multiple languages across India.

Stop it guys: Samantha snaps at paps taking pictures of her outside her gymActor Samantha Ruth Prabhu snapped at the paparazzi stationed outside her gym in Mumbai. She requested them to stop and looked visibly irked.

general news.headline: No trade talks, no US mediation in Pak truce: PM Modi to Trump on phoneDonald Trump has repeatedly claimed that he mediated the ceasefire between India and Pakistan last month and the threat of cutting off trade forced the countries to stop the hostilities.

Iran fires hypersonic missile at Israel, Trump demands Tehran's surrender  Live Updates As the Israel-Iran conflict entered its sixth day, Iran fired a Fattah-1 missile at Tel Aviv shortly after United States President Donald Trump demanded Tehran's 'unconditional surrender'.

What Mark Carney said on Nijjar killing after bilateral meet with PM ModiCanadian Prime Minister Mark Carney appeared cautious as he commented on discussions he had with Prime Minister Narendra Modi on the June 2023 killing of Khalistani terrorist Hardeep Singh Nijjar in British Columbia.

Days after denying parade invite, Trump to meet Pak's Asim Munir over lunchPakistan Army Chief Field Marshal Asim Munir will hold a closed-door lunch with US President Donald Trump on Wednesday at the White House. The visit, part of a five-day US trip, aims to boost strategic ties and includes meetings with top officials.

Anxiety in the air: The mental health aftermath of the Air India crashThe recent Air India crash has triggered widespread flight anxiety, with many travellers reconsidering air travel and experiencing heightened anxiety. Mental health experts explain how to cope with emotional unrest.

Bengaluru couple travel to Goa to get married, he kills her thereA 22-year-old woman from Bengaluru was found murdered in a forest in South Goa. She had travelled to the coastal state with her boyfriend to get married, where a dispute reportedly led him to kill her.

Volcanic eruption near Bali disrupts air travel, several flights make U-turnA massive eruption from Mount Lewotobi in Indonesia grounded multiple Bali-bound flights, including Air India's, as thick ash clouds forced airport shutdowns and prompted the highest volcano alert across the region.

The battle begins: Khamenei responds to Trump's threats amid possible US attackIran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei warned Israel of a harsh response as missile strikes continued on the sixth day of the Israel-Iran conflict. The statement is Khamenei's first public post since US President Donald Trump demanded Iran's unconditional surrender.

Scarlett Johansson, Jonathan Bailey's kiss lights up Jurassic World premiereActors Scarlett Johansson and Jonathan Bailey sparked online buzz after they were seen kissing at the 'Jurassic World Rebirth' premiere in London. The clip quickly went viral, prompting a wave of fan reactions across social media.

On Father's Day, sons get DNA confirmation of parents' deaths in Air India crashBritish couple Ashokbhai and Shobhanaben Patel, victims of the Air India crash, were identified side by side through DNA tests in Ahmedabad, days after the tragedy claimed 274 lives.

Meeting with PM Modi foundational, necessary step: Mark Carney to India TodayCanadian PM described his meeting with PM Modi as "foundational," saying it marks the beginning of efforts by India and Canada to rebuild their relationship based on trust and diplomacy.

The shadow of Sanjay: How Indira Gandhi's son shaped the EmergencyThe second part of the Democracy's Darkest Hour series chronicles how Indira Gandhi's doubts and her son Sanjay Gandhi's ambition triggered one of the most repressive chapters in India's political history.

Is Israel's Rising Lion a push for Iranians to rise up?Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu's handwritten prayer at Jerusalem's Western Wall, "the people shall rise up as a lion", could be more than what meets the eye. The "people" may not be Israelis, but Iranians. Some analysts believe the line nods to Iran's own citizens, who are increasingly disillusioned with Khamenei's regime.

If Khamenei falls, who's next? Inside the race to be Iran's next Supreme LeaderIsraeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu believes killing Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei would "end the conflict". Here's a look at the frontrunners and the secretive selection process that could decide Iran's fate.

Iran preps missiles, threatens to mine key strait if US joins Israel war: ReportIran has reportedly prepped missiles and may mine the Strait of Hormuz if the US joins Israel in striking Tehran. The Pentagon has placed over 40,000 troops on high alert as Trump called for Iran's 'unconditional surrender" and warned that the US knows where Khamenei is hiding.

Shubhanshu Shukla's Axiom Mission 4 delayed again, postponed to June 22The mission, initially set for launch on May 29, faced multiple delays, first to June 8, then to June 10 and 11, after engineers discovered a liquid oxygen leak in the Falcon 9 rocket's boosters.

Tom Cruise to finally get an Oscar, 35 years after his first nominationTom Cruise, Debbie Allen, Wynn Thomas, and Dolly Parton will receive honorary Oscars at the 2025 Governors Awards for their lasting impact on film and humanitarian work.

Breakthrough in India-Canada ties as PM, Mark Carney agree to reinstate envoysThe discussion between PM Modi and Mark Carney was held in view to returning to regular services to citizens and businesses in both India and Canada.

I don't care what she said: Trump shrugs off US spy chief's claim on Iran nukesUS President Donald Trump repudiated Intelligence Director Tulsi Gabbard's assessment that Iran is not building a nuclear weapon. Trump backed Israeli PM Netanyahu's claim that Iran is very close to having a nuclear warhead.

Trouble mounts for Rapido, Uber as Mumbai police files cheating caseThe case was filed against both companies following a complaint by an RTO inspector, after officers conducted dummy rides to verify the violations.

On this day in 1983: Kapil Dev's iconic 175 kept India's World Cup dream aliveOn this day in 1983, Kapil Dev played one of the most iconic innings in cricket history, scoring an unbeaten 175 runs to rescue India from a precarious position and lead them to a remarkable 31-run victory over Zimbabwe in the World Cup.

Ravi Shastri backs Shubman Gill to replace Virat Kohli at No.4 in 1st TestFormer India coach Ravi Shastri has backed Test captain Shubman Gill to replace the retired Virat Kohli in the crucial no.4 spot in the upcoming Test series against England.

Live: Iran's civil aviation authority extends flight cancellations amid Israeli strikesIsrael-Iran Conflict Live Updates: Israel and Iran continued to launch several missiles at each other for the sixth consecutive day. Amid the ongoing crisis in the Middle East, G7 leaders gathered in Canada urged an end to hostilities between Iran and Israel, with French President Emmanuel Macron revealing that his US counterpart, Donald Trump, has already initiated a truce deal between the two warring nations. Israeli strikes on Iran have killed 585 people and wounded 1,326 others, AP reports citing a human rights group. Follow indiatoday.in for live updates.

Amazon CEO hints at more layoffs as AI takes over virtually every corner of the companyAmazon has reportedly indicated that the rise of artificial intelligence (AI) will lead to job cuts at the company over the next few years. Here are the details.

sports.headline: Maxwell emulates Rohit Sharma with superb T20 hundred for Washington FreedomAustralian all-rounder Glenn Maxwell equalled the likes of David Warner and Aaron Finch, Indian legend Rohit Sharma, and England's Jos Buttler as the player with the joint-fourth-most centuries in T20 cricket. Maxwell notched his eighth century in the shortest format during a Major League Cricket (MLC) match for his team, Washington Freedom (WSF).

India Test series as commercially important as Ashes: ECB chief executiveThe upcoming five-match Test series between India and England is commercially as important as the Ashes, according to ECB Chief Executive Richard Gould.

Simone Inzaghi downplays Al-Hilal agreement timeline: Gave everything to InterSimone Inzaghi said he gave his all to Inter Milan before becoming the new manager of Al-Hilal earlier this month. Inzaghi made these remarks after Al-Hilal's CEO said that the move had been agreed before Inter's 5-0 loss to Paris St Germain in the Champions League final.

Not Shubman Gill, former selector wants KL Rahul to bat at Virat Kohli's positionFormer India chief selector has thrown in KL Rahul's name to bat at number four in the upcoming Test series against England, instead of Shubman Gill.

On this day in 1983: Kapil Dev's iconic 175 kept India's World Cup dream aliveOn this day in 1983, Kapil Dev played one of the most iconic innings in cricket history, scoring an unbeaten 175 runs to rescue India from a precarious position and lead them to a remarkable 31-run victory over Zimbabwe in the World Cup.

Club World Cup: Ramos steals show vs Inter; Bellingham struggles on BVB debutSergio Ramos' header gave Inter Milan an early scare but the Champions League finalists found the equaliser to take the draw. Meanwhile, Jobe Bellingham was unable to make much of an impact in his debut for Borussia Dortmund in the FIFA Club World Cup.

Ravi Shastri backs Shubman Gill to replace Virat Kohli at No.4 in 1st TestFormer India coach Ravi Shastri has backed Test captain Shubman Gill to replace the retired Virat Kohli in the crucial no.4 spot in the upcoming Test series against England.

Shardul Thakur or Nitish Reddy, who should start in England? Ravi Shastri answersFormer India cricketer and head coach Ravi Shastri has settled the debate between Shardul Thakur and Nitish Kumar Reddy as the first choice pick for the England Tests.

Shubman Gill's major technical flaw grabs attention of former England batterIndia's newly appointed Test captain Shubman Gill's technique flaw has been highlighted ahead of the all-important five-match Test series against England set to begin from June 20 at Headingley, Leeds.

Test series vs India warm up for Ashes? Swann slammed for bizarre statementFormer England cricketer Graeme Swann called the India vs England Test series a warm-up for the Ashes, sparking backlash from Indian fans online who reminded him of recent results and backed India to dominate the series.

Club World Cup: Ramos steals show vs Inter; Bellingham struggles on BVB debutSergio Ramos' header gave Inter Milan an early scare but the Champions League finalists found the equaliser to take the draw. Meanwhile, Jobe Bellingham was unable to make much of an impact in his debut for Borussia Dortmund in the FIFA Club World Cup.

Ravi Shastri backs Shubman Gill to replace Virat Kohli at No.4 in 1st TestFormer India coach Ravi Shastri has backed Test captain Shubman Gill to replace the retired Virat Kohli in the crucial no.4 spot in the upcoming Test series against England.

Shardul Thakur or Nitish Reddy, who should start in England? Ravi Shastri answersFormer India cricketer and head coach Ravi Shastri has settled the debate between Shardul Thakur and Nitish Kumar Reddy as the first choice pick for the England Tests.

Shubman Gill's major technical flaw grabs attention of former England batterIndia's newly appointed Test captain Shubman Gill's technique flaw has been highlighted ahead of the all-important five-match Test series against England set to begin from June 20 at Headingley, Leeds.

Test series vs India warm up for Ashes? Swann slammed for bizarre statementFormer England cricketer Graeme Swann called the India vs England Test series a warm-up for the Ashes, sparking backlash from Indian fans online who reminded him of recent results and backed India to dominate the series.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
